data.title: Land Records Overview
data.meta_description: The Clark County GIS Land Records group is responsible for maintaining the county tax maps, includingÂ property boundaries and all other legal boundaries required to assess property values or assign fees. The Land Records group also tracks the chain of title and ownership of all land in Clark County. data.text:
Land Records may assist with:

land ownership, acreage, and the mapping of tax parcels

GIS layers related to tax parcels

purchase of survey maps, plat maps, and map products

search Land Records FAQ

The Clark County Land Records group is responsible for maintaining the county tax maps, including property boundaries and all other legal boundaries required to assess property values or assign fees. The Land Records group also tracks the chain of title and ownership of all land in Clark County. They track, map, and compile data pertaining to annexations and other activities that impact property ownership and taxation.

Note: Regarding Mapping

County tax maps are only designed to depict the general size, shape, and location of tax parcels. County tax maps are not surveys, and should not be used to determine the location of property lines on the ground.

info Property Information Center (PIC)

room MapsOnline

Contact info

landrecords@clark.wa.gov

564.397.4641

The Land Records group works with the Clark County GIS department to ensure that information shown on the Property Information Center and MapsOnline is kept accurate and current. The Land Records group also operates the GIS Map Store, providing property information (historic and current) and map products to the public.
